member.name: M:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.SequencePatterns.Probability.CalculatesBits(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
The information content (y-axis) of position i is given by:
``` Ri = log2(4) - (Hi + en) //nt Ri = log2(20) - (Hi + en) //prot ```
4 for DNA/RNA or 20 for protein. Consequently, the maximum sequence conservation per site Is log2 4 = 2 bits for DNA/RNA And log2 20 ≈ 4.32 bits for proteins.

member.name: M:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.SequencePatterns.Probability.HI(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Char,System.Double})
member.remarks: If n equals ZERO, then log2(0) is NaN, n * Math.Log(n, 2) could not be measure, due to the reason of ZERO multiple any number is ZERO, so that if n is ZERO, then set n * Math.Log(n, 2) its value to Zero directly.
